name: Texas Jambalaya
author: PETRA DIXON
summary: This is a hearty, filling meal with only one pot to clean up.
ingredients: ½ cup diced green bell pepper
4 ounces smoked sausage, cut into slices
4 ounces cooked ham, cut into bite-size pieces
2 (10 ounce) cans diced tomatoes with green chile peppers
directions: Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat
Saute onion, green pepper and celery, until onions are soft and translucent
Stir in garlic, and cook another minute
Cook 2 to 3 minutes, to coat the rice with oil, stirring frequently
Pour in tomatoes with green chiles and chicken broth
Season with thyme and bay leaf
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat
Cover, and simmer 20 to 25 minutes, or until liquid is absorbed
Stir in the beans, mix well and heat through
